intro: Dinteranthus microspermus subsp. puberulus, commonly known as the pubescent dinteranthus, is a rare and small flowering plant endemic to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers that bloom during the warmer months.
